intro: Cacalia reclinata, commonly known as the drooping cacalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a low, spreading habit with hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Cacalia reclinata is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to coastal climates with high salt exposure.
